==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|じん|にん|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じんにん}} compound {{m|ltc|神人|tr=*jhin *njin}}. The [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading, so likely the initial borrowing.

Replaced by the ''jinin'' reading.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|じ|んにん}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[d͡ʑĩnnĩɴ]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じんにん}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しんにん'|archaic}} a low-ranking position at a [[shrine]], helping to conduct the yearly ceremonies and patrolling the grounds, among other responsibilities

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|じ|にん|yomi=irreg}}
{{IPAchar|/d͡ʑinnin/}} → {{IPAchar|/d͡ʑinin/}}

Change in pronunciation from ''jinnin''. Now the more common reading.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR"/>

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|慣用読み|Kan'yōyomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|じ|にん}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[d͡ʑinĩɴ]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じにん}}

# from the [[w:Heian period|Heian period]] through the [[w:Muromachi period|Muromachi period]], a low-ranking position at a [[shrine]], helping to conduct the yearly ceremonies and patrolling the grounds, among other responsibilities
#: In the late [[w:Heian period|Heian period]], the ''jinin'' position was useful for the protection offered by shrine authority, and mass [[demonstration]]s were held to press for various governmental changes, much as were held by [[Buddhist]] [[monk]]s. Starting from the [[w:Kamakura period|Kamakura period]], [[lay]] people such as [[merchant]]s or [[performer]]s would [[subordinate]] to a [[shrine]] as ''jinin'' for purposes of [[exemption]] from various [[tax]]es or [[corvee]] [[labor]] requirements.<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="KDJ"/>

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|しん|じん|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しんじん}} compound {{m|ltc|神人|tr=*jhin *njin}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] reading, so likely a later borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|し|んじん}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɕĩnd͡ʑĩɴ]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しんじん}}

# [[god]]s and [[humans]]
# a person of [[god-like]] [[nobility]]
# a person with [[mystical]] or [[god-like]] [[power]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=しんじん|shinto}} alternate for ''jinin'' above: a low-ranking position at a [[shrine]], helping to conduct the yearly ceremonies and patrolling the grounds, among other responsibilities

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|神人同形説|しんじん どうけい せつ}}: a [[belief]] or [[perspective]] that [[apply|applies]] human or human-like qualities to [[god]]s and/or [[spirit]]s, as a kind of [[personification]]

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|しんじん}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しんじん|Christianity}} [[Jesus]], [[Jesus Christ]]

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|かみ|ひと|k2=びと|yomi=kun}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かみびと|神|tr1=kami|t1=god, spirit|人|tr2=hito|t2=person}}.<ref name="KDJ"/> {{rendaku2|sort=かみびと|hito|bito}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ka̠mibito̞]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かみびと}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かみびと|archaic|Shinto}} a [[priest]]
#* {{RQ:Genji Monogatari}} (text [http://etext.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/genji/Mur35GO.html#te8 here]):
#*: {{lang|ja|'''神人'''の手に取りもたる榊葉に / 木綿かけ添ふる深き夜の霜}}
#*:: {{lang|ja|'''かみびと'''のてにとりもたるさかきばに / ゆふかけそふるふかきよのしも}}
#*:: '''''Kamibito''' no te ni torimotaru sakakiba ni / yufu kake sofuru fukaki yo no shimo''
#*::: The deep night's frost accompanies the ceremonial ties / on the sakaki leaves held in the hands of the '''priests'''
